Uses of Class
dnl.node.Node

  • Packages that use Node 
    Package Description
    dnl  
    dnl.link  
    dnl.node  

    • Uses of Node in dnl

      Methods in dnl that return Node 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Node ReadNetwork.createNode​(int id, java.lang.String type, double longitude, double latitude, double elevation)
      Constructs a node with the given parameters.
      Node Network.getNode​(int id)
      Finds the Node with the given id.
      Methods in dnl that return types with arguments of type Node 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.List<Node> Network.getNodes()  
      Methods in dnl with parameters of type Node 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Link ReadNetwork.createLink​(int id, java.lang.String type, Node source, Node dest, double length, double ffspeed, double capacity, int numLanes)
      Constructs a link with the given parameters.
      void Network.dijkstras​(Node origin)
      Runs one-to-all shortest path rooted at the specified origin node.
      Path Network.shortestPath​(Node origin, Node dest)
      This method calls Network.dijkstras(Node) then Network.trace(Node, Node) to find the shortest path between two Nodes.
      Path Network.trace​(Node origin, Node dest)
      After running Network.dijkstras(Node), this method is used to find the shortest path between an origin and a destination.
      Constructor parameters in dnl with type arguments of type Node 
      Constructor Description
      Network​(java.util.List<Node> nodes, java.util.List<Link> links)
      Constructs the Network with the given Node and Link.

    • Uses of Node in dnl.node

      Subclasses of Node in dnl.node 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Diverge
      This class represents a diverge: where 1 upstream link branches out into 2 or more downstream links.
      class  Merge
      This class represents a merge: where 2 or more upstream links combine into 1 downstream link.
      class  PedSignal
      This class models 2 links in series, but the links are separated by a traffic light used to provide access to pedestrians.
      class  Series
      This Node type simply connects two links, possibly with different capacities.
      class  Signal
      This class is used to model a traffic signal.
      class  Sink
      This class models behavior at a sink (at a destination node): all vehicles reaching the sink are removed from the network.
      class  Source
      This class models a source (origin node): vehicles spawn at this location at predetermined rates.
      class  StopSign
      This class models the equal priority intersection discussed in class.
      Methods in dnl.node with parameters of type Node 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int Node.compareTo​(Node rhs)
      Used to sort Nodes by id.
